From: ' 
)" 
ci 
To: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess  
Cc: Alex Conlon etj 
Subject: RE: Scheduling a proffer 
Date: Thu, 04 Apr 2019 01:51:03 +0000 
Importance: Normal 
Received and confirmed, thanks, and please don't hesitate to reach out in the interim if that would be helpful in advance 
of meeting. looking forward to putting faces to names on Friday. 
From: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess < 
Sent: Wednesday, April 03, 2019 21:39 
To: 
Cc: Alex Conlon cli> 
Subject: RE: Scheduling a proffer 
Hi 
Alex C, Jenna, and I are available on Friday at 11 to meet at your office. We'll let you know if we have any questions about 
the form proffer agreement. 
Thanks, 
Alex 
Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess I Kaplan Ilecker & Fink LLP 
Associate 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, April 3, 2019 7:14 PM 
To: Alex Conlon 
Cc: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess 
Subject: RE: Scheduling a proffer 
Alex, 
That makes sense, thanks. Our team is available to do Friday at 11:00, and we can host here at our offices, 
=, if that still works for you both (and Jenna if she's able to join). On our end I expect it will be prosecutors 
, and me, and FBI Special Agent 
Separately, as promised, attached is our form proffer agreement—when we meet with your client we'll add her name and 
counsel information (and also change all the he / him to she/ her, obviously). Please let me know if any questions on that. 
Thanks again, and looking forward to meeting in person on Friday. 
EFTA00030267

 Original Message 
From: Alex Conlon 
Sent: Wednesday, April 03, 2019 15:15 
To: 
  <I 
Cc: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess 
Subject: RE: Scheduling a proffer 
Hi, 
Thanks so much for your email. Fully agree --Jenna is the best. This is for an attorney proffer and if possible, Jenna will 
probably join us. 
I'm not sure whether legally changed her name, or if I was just given her husband's last name 
her about it tonight. Also happy to ask her about phone numbers for anyone associated with Epstein. 
Thanks, 
Alex 
Alex Conlon I Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP 
 Original Message 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, April 3, 2019 3:07 PM 
To: Alex Conlon < 
Cc: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess 
Subject: Re: Scheduling a proffer 
). I'll ask 
That's great, thanks —  and Jenna is fantastic, happy to have her involved. Just to clarify, and to help with our scheduling, I 
take it we'll start with an attorney proffer? Or let me know if I misinterpreted and we're talking about a meeting with the 
client. Either one totally fine but wanted to confirm— let me know and I'll circle back in timing, and will also send you a 
copy of our standard proffer agreement so you have it for your meeting with her this afternoon. 
Two other quick things —  first, we know your client as but I think you mentioned her name has changed? 
Could you please let me know her current last name? 
And second, one very helpful thing for us would be to have any phone numbers she utilized with Epstein or anyone 
associated with him at that time, and/or numbers for him or others she communicated with in connection with him. 
Primarily, that could help to corroborate and confirm her recollections, and it's something we don't need to talk to her 
directly about to get started working on. If you think it would concern her to provide that at this stage, no problem at all, 
we can circle back to it later, but wanted to mention it. 
thanks, 
On Apr 3, 2019, at 14:30, Alex Conlon mailto:wrote: 
EFTA00030268

Hi there, 
Sorry for the delay on our end. Robbie is going to be out of town, but Alex Hess (cc'd here) and I, and our colleague Jenna 
Dabbs (former member of your office), would love to do a proffer with you tomorrow or Friday. We can do it by phone or 
in person, but would prefer to do it in person. 
On Thursday, we are available from 9 to 11AM or after 4PM. On Friday, we are available any time after 11AM. 
What works best for you? 
Thanks! 
Alex 
Alex Conlon I Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
